image.altText: A picture of a sunny resort in Fiji

props.synopsis: Investigations and toxicology tests are ongoing in Fiji after four Australian women who drank cocktails at a local resort were hospitalised.

title.children: Family holiday becomes 'worst nightmare' after Fiji alcohol poisoning

image.altText: Two women standing next to a marine corps captain in uniform.

props.synopsis: The US government is racing to find American journalist Austin Tice in Syria after the fall of the Assad regime more than a week ago. His family believe he is a "high-value" prisoner who has been kept alive after 12 years of imprisonment.

title.children: 'High-value prisoner': The 12-year fight to find an American captured in Syria

image.altText: An image of Scott Rush, Matthew Norman, Chen Si-Yi, Martin Stephens, and Michael Czugaj

props.synopsis: The Melbourne pastor who has ministered to the Bali Nine members for many years expresses her gratitude to the Indonesian president for allowing the remaining five men to return to Australia.

title.children: Australian pastor 'relieved' remaining Bali Nine members back in Australia

image.altText: A former police officer, a 34-year-old male, arriving at the NSW Supreme Court.

props.synopsis: The former police officer who was found guilty of the manslaughter of 95-year-old Clare Nowland is seeking a review of his sacking in the Industrial Relations Commission.

title.children: Kristian White launches court action after losing police job

image.altText: Corporate grey office building and ABC logo

props.synopsis: In addition to increasing funding for the ABC, Labor says it will seek to legislate five-year funding terms for the ABC and SBS to help prevent "political interference".

title.children: Government announces $40m a year funding boost for ABC

image.altText: Australia captain Pat Cummins grimaces as he walks off in the rain during a Test.

props.synopsis: Frustration was the emotion of the day as Australia's best attempts to take control of the third Test at the Gabba were spoiled time and again by the most annoying rain possible.

title.children: Australia frustrated by rain, the only thing that can save India

image.altText: A group of half naked men sit on the ground beneath a ruined building.

props.synopsis: Jabalia, in the north of Gaza, has suffered some of the most intense bombardments by Israel since its war with Hamas began more than a year ago. Six residents have shared with the ABC their harrowing stories of one day.

title.children: A shocking image emerged from northern Gaza. We tracked down a man in it

image.altText: A police vehicle with bushland and smoke in the background

props.synopsis: People had been urged to evacuate the area around a fire near Creswick, 20 kilometres north of Ballarat, amid heatwave conditions across Victoria.

title.children: Emergency warning downgraded for bushfire in Victoria's west

image.altText: HSBC signage

props.synopsis: The corporate watchdog is suing banking giant HSBC over a scam that netted $23 million, alleging it failed to protect 950 Australian customers.

title.children: ASIC to sue HSBC over 'spoofing' scam

image.altText: Chalmers looks serious as he stares out of frame.

props.synopsis: Economists are concerned that the Reserve Bank's overhaul could risk delaying interest rate relief for millions of mortgage borrowers.

title.children: Economists warn RBA board changes risk delaying interest rate cut

image.altText: The sun behind trees.

props.synopsis: A cool change is expected to bring relief late on Monday, as a heatwave sends temperatures soaring past 45C in Victoria's north.

title.children: Temperatures hit 47C in Victoria as heatwave descends across state

image.altText: The sun rises with a plant pictured in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Two Riverina towns reached record December highs today, but several other southern and western NSW towns fell short. It comes as a heatwave sweeps across the country.

title.children: Parts of NSW swelter in record heat, but others fail to reach predictions

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson smiling enters Federal Court in Sydney before Bruce Lehrmann defamation judgment, media around

props.synopsis: Federal Court Justice Michael Lee expresses frustration over further delays in the costs battle between journalist Lisa Wilkinson and Network Ten over the Bruce Lehrmann defamation case, telling the court he wants an end to his involvement in it.

title.children: 'I want to bring this to an end': Frustration in court over costs dispute between Ten and Wilkinson

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie looks into camera with a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: Whether it's "Faux outrage" or online death threats, it's risky being a whistleblower and vested interests have a lot to answer for.

title.children: Doctors have received death threats for speaking out about colleagues

image.altText: Ash Centra holding her Collingwood gurnsey, next to a pair of members of the Collingwood club

props.synopsis: Midfield prodigy Ash Centra headlines the first AFLW national draft, taken as the number one pick by Collingwood.

title.children: Ash Centra taken as number one pick in first AFLW national draft

image.altText: Moira Deeming appears serious as she walks through the parliament carpark, wearing a purple blazer.

props.synopsis: A group of Victorian Liberal MPs are a pushing to bring ousted MP Moira Deeming back into the party room following her Federal Court victory against party leader John Pesutto.

title.children: Liberal MPs call for vote on reinstating Moira Deeming to party room

image.altText: A bright red small crocodile with black spots.

props.synopsis: A soft furred hedgehog, a high-altitude crocodile newt and a keelback snake are some of the of the 234 new species to have been found in South-East Asia.

title.children: Vampire hedgehogs and limestone eyelash vipers: Meet the new species in Asia

image.altText: Two men dressed in black walk across a road. A cloud of smoke comes out of one of the men's mouths.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old WA man who was filmed laughing as he sped towards calves at a property near Geraldton has been sentenced.

title.children: Driver jailed for running over calves in 'sadistic' act of animal cruelty

image.altText: A female mine worker walks past a mine dump truck at a coal mine in central Queensland.

props.synopsis: Wednesday's update to the budget will reveal billions less in tax is expected from the mining sector, as the government sets expectations for a coming decade of budgets in deficit.

title.children: $100b blow to mining exports to knock billions out of government coffers

image.altText: The side of a police car with the logo and word Police.

props.synopsis: Detectives say the 21-year-old man's body was discovered in the back seat of a car in the middle of a rural road near Townsville.

title.children: Homicide investigation launched after young man's body found in car

image.altText: Composite image of India bowler Jasprit Bumrah and cricket commentator Isa Guha.

props.synopsis: Fox Sports commentator Isa Guha says she is "deeply sorry" for a poor choice of words while talking about India bowler Jasprit Bumrah during the third Test at the Gabba.

title.children: Cricket commentator Isa Guha apologises for calling Jasprit Bumrah 'most valuable primate'

image.altText: Doreen Langham's photo on a cracked phone with lights and sirens in the background.

props.synopsis: Doreen Langham was set alight by her ex-partner in 2021 in one of Queensland's most horrific domestic violence murders. Could a warning from inside police ranks have changed the outcome?

title.children: Cracks in police record-keeping flagged before Doreen Langham's death

image.altText: Screenshot of a Moochies watch for sale online. The watch face shows a woman smiling with 'mum' as the contact being called.

props.synopsis: The company behind Moochies watches is in liquidation, but the devices are still being sold despite mounting complaints of SIM card issues, GPS errors and difficulties contacting the firm for refunds.

title.children: Telco ombudsman concerned 'unwitting parents' buying Moochies watches

image.altText: Yoon Suk Yeol stands behind a podium, speaking into a microphone, with two flags behind him

props.synopsis: The opposition-controlled South Korean parliament has voted to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over his short-lived attempt to impose martial law. What happens next?

title.children: Where to now for South Korea's president?

image.altText: A man with unruly hair and a beard looks directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Police say a damaged Toyota Kluger could be linked to the disappearance of a man who has been missing from his northern NSW property since last year.

title.children: Daughter desperate for information on missing dad as police probe damaged car

image.altText: multiple drones light up the night sky in New Jersey

props.synopsis: There are calls for new laws around addressing dangerous drone activity after thousands of mysterious sightings were reported in several US states.

title.children: FBI official says US public overreacting as thousands puzzle over mystery drones

image.altText: Generic AFP Badge

props.synopsis: Senior Australian Federal Police detective Trent Madders will face trial in the ACT Supreme Court next year, facing three charges of aggravated perjury, destroying or concealing evidence, and perverting the course of justice.

title.children: Senior AFP detective to face trial for charges including perjury

image.altText: A river with very green water snakes through trees.

props.synopsis: Extreme heat forecast across western NSW has river rangers, locals and the state government worried about the possibility of another mass fish kill.

title.children: Fish kill fears as Darling River turns a sickly shade of green

image.altText: woman wrapping presents under the christmas tree

props.synopsis: Helping kids avoid the comparison trap, teaching them about the value of a dollar, and ensuring they know Christmas is about more than gifts are some of the motivations behind parents' intentional approach to what's from Santa, and what isn't.

title.children: 'We do small gifts from Santa': Different ways parents handle gift-giving at Christmas

image.altText: children play with building bricks

props.synopsis: Three Genius Childcare workers take legal action against the company over allegations it intentionally paid wages late and failed to pay them thousands of dollars in superannuation.

title.children: Childcare chaos as workers sue company

image.altText: ezra mam walking out of court

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old pleaded guilty in Brisbane Magistrates Court to one count of driving while relevant drug is present in blood, and driving without a licence.

title.children: Broncos' Ezra Mam fined after crashing ute while on 'cocktail' of drugs

image.altText: A man with a bald head wearing a suit jacket and shirt stands outside in profile.

props.synopsis: Tim Pallas announces he is standing down as Victorian treasurer and that he will retire from politics.

title.children: Victorian Treasurer Tim Pallas to quit politics

image.altText: A car and caravan driving through floodwater.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain has made river crossings dangerous in WA's north, with emergency services called to help people from stricken vehicles.

title.children: Three rescues as rain brings flooding to East Pilbara

image.altText: A man on a motorbike with the dog in a sidecar in a barren landscape.

props.synopsis: When ex-con Lang and a black dog strike up an unlikely friendship, even those with ambivalent feelings towards pooches will likely find something to connect with in this soulful, deftly understated film.

title.children: Xin the whippet will steal your heart in this Cannes-award-winning film
